facts.1: Patriot Day is observed on September 11th to honor the memory of the nearly 3,000 people who lost their lives in the terrorist attacks on September 11, 2001.
facts.2: The day is marked by ceremonies and events across the United States, including moments of silence and the reading of victims' names.
facts.3: Patriot Day was established by a joint resolution of the U.S. Congress and signed into law by President George W. Bush in December 2001.

facts.1: National Make Your Bed Day encourages people to start their day by making their bed, promoting a sense of accomplishment and organization.
facts.2: Studies have shown that making your bed can lead to better productivity and improved mental health.
facts.3: The day is a reminder of the importance of small daily habits in creating a positive and organized living environment.

facts.1: National Hot Cross Bun Day celebrates the delicious spiced buns traditionally eaten during the Easter season.
facts.2: Hot cross buns are marked with a cross on top, symbolizing the crucifixion of Jesus Christ.
facts.3: The buns are typically made with raisins or currants and flavored with spices like cinnamon and nutmeg.
